title: Modified typeface from the 80s
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415064159im_/http:/typophile.com/files/trace%202_3599.jpg)

This logo has obviously been altered, but I'm wondering if anyone knows of the typeface this was based on? Something with a circle inside the capital "P"...the lowercase "e"might have been rotated. The original logo was designed in 1989 if that helps.

Thanks!

Font: 

 Modified- Avant Garde Gothic Bold 

Solved By: 

 [oldnick](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415064159/http:/typophile.com/user/6470 "View user profile.")
author: tflavin

comments.content: Probably Avant Garde Gothic Bold. The dot inside the P (which probably began life as an O) was added. The r is a modified n; the s is a mess; and, as you suspected, the e has probably been rotated.
